text: Eva Abu Halaweh (Arabic: إيفا أبو حلاوة), born 1975, is a Jordanian lawyer and human rights activist. In 2011 she received the International Women of Courage Award from the U.S. Department of State. Eva works against honor killings. She also works against torture and abuse in the Jordanian prisons and police stations. == Work == Eva has a bachelor's degree in law and a master’s degree in diplomacy. Eva had her own private law practice. She also worked for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees as a legal advisor. Eva is the Executive Director of the Mizan Law Group for Human Rights. She helped start the organization. ==Awards == * International Women of Courage Award, 2011 ==Related pages== * 2011 International Women of Courage Awards, U.S. State Department photostream on Flickr *Secretary's International Women of Courage Award (U.S. Department of State) == References == == Other websites == * Mizan Law Group ميزان القانون Category:Women who received the International Women of Courage Award Category:Living people Category:Jordanian people Category:Human rights activists Category:Asian lawyers Category:1975 births
title: Eva Abu Halaweh
